text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Australian woman claims Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years
text.summary1: (human1) Valeska Paris, an Australian woman and former Scientologist, has claimed that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years aboard the Scientology-owned cruise ship Freewinds, where she was forced to work in the engine room, though the Church of Scientology denies these allegations.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) An Australian woman, Valeska Paris, claims she was imprisoned for 12 years on the Church of Scientology's cruise ship Freewinds, where she allegedly had her passport confiscated and was forced to work long hours, though the Church denies these allegations.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) Former Scientologist Valeska Paris claims the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for 12 years on their cruise ship, Freewinds, where she endured harsh work conditions and passport confiscation due to her mother's criticism of the Church; The Church denies the allegations, asserting she stayed voluntarily and has ulterior motives for her claims.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) Valeska Paris, an Australian woman and former Scientologist, claims that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years on its cruise ship, Freewinds, and forced her to work long hours without sleep, and that she was kept at a “rehabilitation camp” in Sydney after she left the ship.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Australian former Scientologist Valeska Paris claims she was imprisoned by the Church of Scientology for twelve years, working on their cruise ship Freewinds and subjected to forced labor and separation from her family.
